reasoning: Congenital vocal cord paralysis is second most common congenital laryngeal abnormality, with majority being unilateral. Bilateral vocal cord paralysis incidence ~0.75 per million births. Estimated prevalence of unilateral cases <0.1 per 100k based on pediatric laryngeal condition frequency. Limited epidemiological data specifically for unilateral congenital cases.
source: A Study of incidence and etiopathology of vocal cord paralysis - PMC3450463
